reviews.text:
Parroquia Purisima Concepcion or the Church of the Conception, or even a third title of Basilica of the Immaculate Conception and Assumption of Our Lady, as it was made a minor basilica in 2009 by Pope Benedict XVI. 

The church dates back to the 5th Century and built in the Gothic style. The church has a single nave with a wide floor divided into six sections, with ribbed vaults typical of Gothic architecture. It has a pentagonal apse, covered with a vault that resembles a boat sail blown by the wind. By far the most impressive parts of the church is the stained glass windows depicting the church watching over it's flock, and the cloister with it's mini garden.
